meanings.definition: Make or cause to make a loud, harsh sound.
meanings.sent1: The metal pot clanged against the stove.
meanings.sent2: The church bell clanged loudly in the distance.
meanings.sent3: As the pots and pans clanged together, it sounded like a musical performance.
meanings.sent4: The hammer clanged against the anvil, echoing through the workshop.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock clanged, jolting him awake.

meanings.sent1: The loud clang of the bell signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent2: The clang of metal echoed through the empty warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected clang made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The clang of the gong marked the beginning of the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The clang of the door shutting behind her echoed in the hallway.
